Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/JavaDerek>@JavaDerek</denchmark-link> . Currently, you need access to a LoadBalancer Service in order to use platform=existing_arrikto. It seems that you don't have access to that in your cluster and kfctl blows up trying to get the LoadBalancer Service: <denchmark-code>Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Apply failed for existing_arrikto: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: timed out while waiting to get istio-ingressgateway Service ExternalIP </denchmark-code>
Soon, there will be instructions to bypass this restriction. If you want to try existing_arrikto, you can test with a GKE cluster using the script provided in the docs.

Fair enough. I'll try that. In the meantime, do you want me to do a pull request to add the above caveat to the install doc page, or do you want to leave it as-is until you have the workaround instructions?
